claim.text: Wetland ecosystems must migrate either inland or upstream, or face gradual submergence in deeper, increasingly saline water
claim.location: Section 3.4.2.4; Andres et al., 2019; Jones et al., 2019b; Cohen et al., 2020; Mafi-Gholami et al., 2020; Magolan and Halls, 2020; Sklar et al., 2021
claim.exact_quote: Otherwise, wetland ecosystems must migrate either inland or upstream, or face gradual submergence in deeper, increasingly saline water (very high confidence)

evidence.evidence_text: Otherwise, wetland ecosystems must migrate either inland or upstream, or face gradual submergence in deeper, increasingly saline water (very high confidence) (Andres et al., 2019; Jones et al., 2019b; Cohen et al., 2020; Mafi-Gholami et al., 2020; Magolan and Halls, 2020; Sklar et al., 2021).
evidence.exact_quote: Otherwise, wetland ecosystems must migrate either inland or upstream, or face gradual submergence in deeper, increasingly saline water (very high confidence) (Andres et al., 2019; Jones et al., 2019b; Cohen et al., 2020; Mafi-Gholami et al., 2020; Magolan and Halls, 2020; Sklar et al., 2021).

claim.text: Restoration of wetlands could support livelihoods and help sequester carbon
claim.exact_quote: Restoration of wetlands could support livelihoods and help sequester carbon (medium confidence), provided they are allowed accommodation space

evidence.evidence_text: Restoration of wetlands could support livelihoods and help sequester carbon (medium confidence), provided they are allowed accommodation space. (WGII TS.D)
evidence.exact_quote: Restoration of wetlands could support livelihoods and help sequester carbon (medium confidence), provided they are allowed accommodation space.

conclusion.key_limitations: Depends on availability of accommodation space

claim.text: Inclusive water regimes that overcome social inequalities and approaches including nature-based solutions, such as wetland restoration and water storage and infiltration infrastructure, have been found to be more successful for adaptation and sustainable development
claim.exact_quote: Inclusive water regimes that overcome social inequalities and approaches including nature-based solutions, such as wetland restoration and water storage and infiltration infrastructure, with synergies for ecosystem conservation and disaster risk reduction, have been found to be more successful for adaptation and sustainable development (high confidence)

evidence.evidence_text: Inclusive water regimes that overcome social inequalities and approaches including nature-based solutions, such as wetland restoration and water storage and infiltration infrastructure, have been found to be more successful for adaptation and sustainable development (high confidence). (WGII 12.ES)
evidence.exact_quote: Inclusive water regimes that overcome social inequalities and approaches including nature-based solutions, such as wetland restoration and water storage and infiltration infrastructure, have been found to be more successful for adaptation and sustainable development (high confidence).

claim.text: Without careful management of freshwater inputs, sediment augmentation and/or the restoration of shorelines to more natural states, transformation and loss of intertidal areas and wetland vegetation will increase with SLR
claim.exact_quote: Without careful management of freshwater inputs, sediment augmentation and/or the restoration of shorelines to more natural states, transformation and loss of in- tertidal areas and wetland vegetation will increase with SLR (high confidence)

evidence.evidence_text: Without careful management of freshwater inputs, sediment augmentation and/or the restoration of shorelines to more natural states, transformation and loss of intertidal areas and wetland vegetation will increase with SLR (high confidence) (Doughty et al., 2019; Leuven et al., 2019; Yu et al., 2019; Raw et al., 2020; Shih, 2020; Stein et al., 2020), with small, shallow microtidal estuaries being more vulnerable to impacts than deeper estuaries with well-developed sediments (medium confidence) (Leuven et al., 2019; Williamson and Guinder, 2021).
evidence.exact_quote: Without careful management of freshwater inputs, sediment augmentation and/or the restoration of shorelines to more natural states, transformation and loss of intertidal areas and wetland vegetation will increase with SLR (high confidence) (Doughty et al., 2019; Leuven et al., 2019; Yu et al., 2019; Raw et al., 2020; Shih, 2020; Stein et al., 2020), with small, shallow microtidal estuaries being more vulnerable to impacts than deeper estuaries with well-developed sediments (medium confidence) (Leuven et al., 2019; Williamson and Guinder, 2021).

claim.text: Coastal wetlands protect against coastal erosion and flooding associated with storms and sea level rise where sufficient space and adequate habitats are available until rates of sea level rise exceed natural adaptive capacity to build sediment
claim.exact_quote: Coastal wetlands protect against coastal erosion and flooding associated with storms and sea level rise where sufficient space and adequate habitats are available until rates of sea level rise exceed natural adaptive capacity to build sediment (very high confidence)

evidence.evidence_text: Coastal wetlands protect against coastal erosion and flooding associated with storms and sea level rise where sufficient space and adequate habitats are available until rates of sea level rise exceed natural adaptive capacity to build sediment (very high confidence). (WGII 14.5)
evidence.exact_quote: Coastal wetlands protect against coastal erosion and flooding associated with storms and sea level rise where sufficient space and adequate habitats are available until rates of sea level rise exceed natural adaptive capacity to build sediment (very high confidence).

claim.text: Nature-based interventions, for example wetlands and salt marshes, can reduce impacts and costs while supporting biodiversity and livelihoods but have limits under high warming levels and rapid sea level rise
claim.exact_quote: Nature-based interventions, for example wetlands and salt marshes, can reduce impacts and costs while supporting biodiversity and livelihoods but have limits under high warming levels and rapid sea level rise (high confidence)

evidence.evidence_text: Nature-based interventions, for example wetlands and salt marshes, can reduce impacts and costs while supporting biodiversity and livelihoods but have limits under high warming levels and rapid sea level rise (high confidence). (WGII 15.3)
evidence.exact_quote: Nature-based interventions, for example wetlands and salt marshes, can reduce impacts and costs while supporting biodiversity and livelihoods but have limits under high warming levels and rapid sea level rise (high confidence).

claim.text: There is medium confidence that coastal wetland restoration has a technical potential of 0.3 (0.04–0.84) gtco2-eq yr –1 of which 0.1 (0.05–0.2) gtco2-eq yr –1 is available up to usd100 tco2–1
claim.exact_quote: There is medium confidence that coastal wetland restoration has a technical potential of 0.3 (0.04–0.84) gtco2-eq yr –1 of which 0.1 (0.05–0.2) gtco2-eq yr –1 is available up to usd100 tco2–1

evidence.evidence_text: There is medium confidence that coastal wetland restoration has a technical potential of 0.3 (0.04–0.84) gtco2-eq yr –1 of which 0.1 (0.05–0.2) gtco2-eq yr –1 is available up to usd100 tco2–1. (WGIII 7.4)
evidence.exact_quote: There is medium confidence that coastal wetland restoration has a technical potential of 0.3 (0.04–0.84) gtco2-eq yr –1 of which 0.1 (0.05–0.2) gtco2-eq yr –1 is available up to usd100 tco2–1.

claim.text: There is high confidence that coastal wetlands, especially mangroves, contain large carbon stocks relative to other ecosystems and medium confidence that restoration will reinstate pre-disturbance carbon sequestration rates
claim.exact_quote: There is high confidence that coastal wetlands, especially mangroves, contain large carbon stocks relative to other ecosystems and medium confidence that restoration will reinstate pre-disturbance carbon sequestration rates

evidence.evidence_text: There is high confidence that coastal wetlands, especially mangroves, contain large carbon stocks relative to other ecosystems and medium confidence that restoration will reinstate pre-disturbance carbon sequestration rates. (WGIII 7.4)
evidence.exact_quote: There is high confidence that coastal wetlands, especially mangroves, contain large carbon stocks relative to other ecosystems and medium confidence that restoration will reinstate pre-disturbance carbon sequestration rates.

claim.text: There is low confidence on the response of coastal wetlands to climate change; however, there is high confidence that coastal wetland restoration will provide a suite of valuable co-benefits
